Below are descriptions for common bodyweight exercises
Pushups: Enter plank position on all fours and tighten core. Lower body until chest skims floor. Pause and push body back up. Focus on activating core and back muscles.
Pullups: Grasp a pullup bar with overhand grip shoulder width apart. Pull body upwards while squeezing lats and core until chin is above the bar. Pause, then slowly lower back to starting position.
Squats: Stand tall with tight core, then squat down. Then push weight through heels to stand back upright.
Crunches: Lie on back with bent knees and feet hip width apart on floor. Contract abs and lift upper body, pause, and return down.
Below are descriptions for common weighted exercises
Squats: Tighten core and stand tall with chest up. Hold barbell across back of your shoulders. Squat down as low as possible, then focus on pushing weight through heels to stand back upright.
Bench press: Lie flat on bench with barbell on chest, gripped at shoulder width. Push bar straight upwards, maintaining strong wrists.

Push press: Stand tall with a tight core and hold barbell across front of shoulders. Bend knees and then push through heels to stand upright while pushing barbell directly overhead. Slowly lower barbell back to shoulders.
Lunges: Same as squat form, but stepping one leg back on the way down.
This app is best suited for intermediate to advanced level athletes. The following information is advice for beginners that are building a foundation. "
⦾ For building muscle mass, use higher weights and lower repetitions. For building leaner muscle and endurance, use higher weights and lower repetitions."
⦾ For each exercise, try to use a weight that you can repeat for 3 sets of 8-12 repetitions that challenges you."
⦾ Do not challenge yourself beyond reason: Always ensure that the weight you are using is within you capabilities or use an experienced spotter. "
